0.Quote: I choose a lazy person to do a hard job, because a lazy person will find an easy way to do it.
0.Author: ~ Bill Gates

1.Quote: No man goes before his time—unless the boss leaves early.
1.Author: ~ Groucho Marx

2.Quote: Doing nothing is very hard to do… you never know when you’re finished.
2.Author: ~ Leslie Nielsen

3.Quote: It takes less time to do a thing right, than it does to explain why you did it wrong.
3.Author: ~ Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

4.Quote: If you think your boss is stupid, remember: you wouldn’t have a job if he was any smarter.
4.Author: ~ John Gotti

5.Quote: Most of what we call management consists of making it difficult for people to get their work done.
5.Author: ~ Peter Drucker

6.Quote: It is better to have one person working with you than three people working for you.
6.Author: ~ Dwight D. Eisenhower

7.Quote: People who never do any more than they get paid for, never get paid for any more than they do.
7.Author: ~ Elbert Hubbard

8.Quote: I am a friend of the working man, and I would rather be his friend, than be one.
8.Author: ~ Clarence Darrow

9.Quote: The best way to appreciate your job is to imagine yourself without one.
9.Author: ~ Oscar Wilde

10.Quote: Most people work just hard enough not to get fired and get paid just enough money not to quit.
10.Author: ~ George Carlin

11.Quote: It’s a shame that the only thing a man can do for eight hours a day is work. He can’t eat for eight hours; he can’t drink for eight hours; he can’t make love for eight hours. The only thing a man can do for eight hours is work.
11.Author: ~ William Faulkner

12.Quote: Hard work never killed anybody, but why take a chance?
12.Author: ~ Edgar Bergen

13.Quote: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well neither does bathing. That’s why we recommend it daily.
13.Author: ~ Zig Ziglar

14.Quote: As I have gotten older and wiser, I discovered that there are six things that I really loved about my job. Payday, lunchtime, quitting time, vacation time, holidays, and of course retirement.
14.Author: ~ Tom Goins

15.Quote: I like work; it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
15.Author: ~ Jerome K. Jerome

16.Quote: The only thing that ever sat its way to success was a hen.
16.Author: ~ Sarah Brown

17.Quote: If hard work is the key to success, most people would rather pick the lock.
17.Author: ~ Claude McDonald

18.Quote: The easiest job in the world has to be coroner. Surgery on dead people. What’s the worst thing that could happen? If everything went wrong, maybe you’d get a pulse.
18.Author: ~ Dennis Miller

19.Quote: My keyboard must be broken, I keep hitting the escape key, but I’m still at work.
19.Author: ~  Anonymous

20.Quote: Every day I get up and look through the Forbes list of the richest people in America. If I’m not there, I go to work.
20.Author: ~ Robert Orben

21.Quote: Delegate your work. Stop spending dollar time on penny jobs.
21.Author: ~ Mary Kay Ash

22.Quote: I always give 100% at Work: 10% Monday, 23% Tuesday, 40% Wednesday, 22% Thursday, and 5% Friday.
22.Author: ~ Anonymous

23.Quote: Getting paid to sleep… that’s my dream job.
23.Author: ~ Anonymous

24.Quote: The closest to perfection a person ever comes is when he fills out a job application form.
24.Author: ~ Stanley J. Randall

25.Quote: If A equals success, then the formula is A = X + Y + Z. Where X is work. Y is play. Z is keep your mouth shut.
25.Author: ~ Albert Einstein

26.Quote: Son, if you really want something in this life, you have to work for it. Now quiet! They’re about to announce the lottery numbers.
26.Author: ~ Homer Simpson

27.Quote: There’s no secret about success. Did you ever know a successful man who didn’t tell you about it?
27.Author: ~ Kin Hubbard

28.Quote: There’s no business like show business, but there are several businesses like accounting.
28.Author: ~ David Letterman

29.Quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
29.Author: ~ Robert Frost

30.Quote: Anyone who can walk to the welfare office can walk to work.
30.Author: ~ Al Capp

31.Quote: Find a job you like and you add five days to every week.
31.Author: ~ H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

32.Quote: Beat the 5 o’clock rush, leave work at noon.
32.Author: ~ Anonymous

33.Quote: Sometimes I spend the whole meeting wondering how they got the big meeting table through the door.
33.Author: ~ Anonymous

34.Quote: People are still willing to do an honest day’s work. The problem is they want a week’s pay for it.
34.Author: ~ Joey Adams

35.Quote: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having enough sense to be lazy.
35.Author: ~ Charlie McCarthy

36.Quote: An expert is a man who has made all the mistakes which can be made in a very narrow field.
36.Author: ~ Niels Bohr

37.Quote: The reward for good work is more work.
37.Author: ~ Francesca Elisia

38.Quote: It’s just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.
38.Author: ~ Muhammad Ali

39.Quote: Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work.
39.Author: ~ Earl Nightingale

40.Quote: Pride, commitment and teamwork are words they use to get you to work for free.
40.Author: ~ Anonymous

41.Quote: My boss told me to start every presentation with a joke. The first slide was my paycheck.
41.Author: ~ Anonymous

42.Quote: A lot of fellows nowadays have a B.A., M.D., or Ph.D. Unfortunately, they don’t have a J.O.B.
42.Author: ~ Fats Domino

43.Quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn’t you say so? There’s a support group for that. It’s called everybody, and they meet at the bar.
43.Author: ~ Drew Carey

44.Quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: ‘Whose?'
44.Author: ~ Don Marquis

45.Quote: Going to work for a large company is like getting on a train. Are you going sixty miles an hour or is the train going sixty miles an hour and you’re just sitting still?
45.Author: ~ J. Paul Getty

46.Quote: I’ve got all the money I’ll ever need, if I die by four o’clock.
46.Author: ~ Henny Youngman

47.Quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure.
47.Author: ~ Mark Twain

48.Quote: When I was 16 I worked in a pet store, and they fired me because . . . they had three snakes, and one day I braided them.
48.Author: ~ Steven Alexander Wright

49.Quote: Even if you are on the right track, you will get run over if you just sit there.
49.Author: ~ Will Rogers

50.Quote: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day!
50.Author: ~ Anonymous

51.Quote: Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
51.Author: ~ Erma Bombeck

52.Quote: A baseball game is twice as much fun if you’re seeing it on the company’s time.
52.Author: ~ William C. Feather

53.Quote: The remaining work to finish in order to reach your goal increases as the deadline approaches.
53.Author: ~ Bove’s Theorem

54.Quote: The taxpayer—that’s someone who works for the federal government but doesn’t have to take the civil service examination.
54.Author: ~ Ronald Reagan

55.Quote: Early to bed and early to rise probably indicates unskilled labor.
55.Author: ~ John Ciardi

56.Quote: It’s a funny feeling to work with people who you consider your colleagues and to realize that they actually are young enough to be your children.
56.Author: ~ Alan Alda

57.Quote: I’m not retiring, I am graduating . . . retirement means that you’ll just go ahead and live on your laurels and surf all day in Oceanside. It ain’t going to happen.
57.Author: ~ Junior Seau

58.Quote: I used to work at McDonald’s making minimum wage. You know what that means? You know what your boss was trying to say? It’s like, ‘Hey if I could pay you less, I would, but it’s against the law.’
58.Author: ~ Chris Rock

59.Quote: The British soldier can stand up to anything except the British War Office.
59.Author: ~ George Bernard Shaw

60.Quote: Where people aren’t having fun, they seldom produce good work.
60.Author: ~ David Ogilvy

61.Quote: Coworkers are like Christmas lights. They hang together, half of them don’t work and the other half aren’t so bright.
61.Author: ~ Anonymous

62.Quote: I hate when I lose things at work, like pens, papers, sanity and dreams.
62.Author: ~ Anonymous

63.Quote: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.
63.Author: ~ Betty Reese

64.Quote: Unemployment is capitalism’s way of getting you to plant a garden.
64.Author: ~ Orson Scott Card

65.Quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
65.Author: ~ Thomas Edison

66.Quote: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
66.Author: ~ Lily Tomlin

67.Quote: In fifty years, he never worked a day. To him, nine to five was odds on a horse.
67.Author: ~ Archie Bunker

68.Quote: If you had to identify in one word the reason why the human race has not achieved and never will achieve its full potential, that word would be ‘meetings’.
68.Author: ~ Dave Barry

69.Quote: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to a thing till you get there.
69.Author: ~ Josh Billings

70.Quote: Leaders who don’t listen will eventually be surrounded by people who have nothing to say.
70.Author: ~ Andy Stanley

71.Quote: I believe in hard work. But, it will take some time to make this ‘believe’ into a real thing!
71.Author: ~ Anonymous

72.Quote: Education cost money. But then again so does ignorance.
72.Author: ~ Sir Claus Moser

73.Quote: Nobody ever wrote down a plan to be broke, fat lazy, or stupid. Those things are what happen when you didn’t have a plan.
73.Author: ~ Larry Winget

74.Quote: The easiest job in the world has to be coroner. Surgery on dead people. What’s the worst thing that could happen? If everything went wrong, maybe you’d get a pulse.
74.Author: ~ Denise Miller

75.Quote: If a man smiles all the time, he’s probably selling something that doesn’t work.
75.Author: ~ Woody Allen

76.Quote: God put me on this Earth to accomplish a certain number of things. Right now, I am so far behind I will never die.
76.Author: ~ Bill Watterson

77.Quote: One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one’s work is terribly important.
77.Author: ~ Bertrand Russell

78.Quote: Hard work beats talent when talent doesn’t work hard.
78.Author: ~ Tim Notke

79.Quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
79.Author: ~ Vince Lombardi

80.Quote: Work is a necessity for man. Man invented the alarm clock.
80.Author: ~ Pablo Picasso

81.Quote: An expert is a man who tells you a simple thing in a confused way in such a fashion as to make you think the confusion is your own fault.
81.Author: ~ William Castle

82.Quote: What I don’t like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.
82.Author: ~ Phyllis Diller

83.Quote: Work is against human nature. The proof is that it makes us tired.
83.Author: ~ Michel Tournier

84.Quote: Give a man a fish, and you’ll feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and he’ll buy a funny hat. Talk to a hungry man about fish, and you’re a consultant.
84.Author: ~ Scott Adams

85.Quote: Hear no evil, see no evil, and speak no evil—and you’ll never get a job working for a tabloid.
85.Author: ~ Phil Pastoret

86.Quote: I work for myself, which is fun. Except when I call in sick, I know I’m lying.
86.Author: ~ Rita Rudner

87.Quote: Like vinegar to the teeth, and smoke to the eyes, so are the lazy to their employers.
87.Author: ~ Proverb 10:26

88.Quote: A diamond is merely a lump of coal that did well under pressure.
88.Author: ~ Henry Kissenger

89.Quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
89.Author: ~ Charles Lamb

90.Quote: Show me a man who is a good loser and I’ll show you a man who is playing golf with his boss.
90.Author: ~ Jim Murray

91.Quote: My son is now an ‘entrepreneur.’ That’s what you’re called when you don’t have a job.
91.Author: ~ Ted Turner

92.Quote: Why do people say they wish everyday was Friday? If it was always Friday, we’d be here every freakin’ day.
92.Author: ~ Ed Bernard

93.Quote: Work is the greatest thing in the world, so we should always save some of it for tomorrow.
93.Author: ~ Don Herold

94.Quote: The elevator to success is out of order. You’ll have to use the stairs… one step at a time.
94.Author: ~ Joe Girard

95.Quote: Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don’t turn up at all.
95.Author: ~ Sam Ewing

96.Quote: His insomnia was so bad, he couldn’t sleep during office hours.
96.Author: ~ Arthur Baer

97.Quote: People who work sitting down get paid more than people who work standing up.
97.Author: ~ Ogden Nash

98.Quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
98.Author: ~ Douglas Adams

99.Quote: I don’t want any yes-men around me. I want everyone to tell me the truth–even if it costs him his job.
99.Author: ~ Samuel Goldwyn

100.Quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can’t live long enough to make them all yourself.
100.Author: ~ Anonymous

101.Quote: The world is divided into people who do things–and people who get the credit.
101.Author: ~ Dwight Morrow

102.Quote: Whenever you are asked if you can do a job, tell ’em, “Certainly, I can!” Then get busy and find out how to do it.
102.Author: ~ Theodore Roosevelt

103.Quote: Everybody makes mistakes. The trick is to make mistakes when no one is looking.
103.Author: ~ Anonymous

104.Quote: The fellow who never makes a mistake takes his orders from one who does.
104.Author: ~ Anonymous

105.Quote: Hard work is damn near as overrated as monogamy.
105.Author: ~ Huey Long

106.Quote: If you tell the boss you were late for work because you had a flat tire, the next morning you will have a flat tire.
106.Author: ~ Cannon’s Law

107.Quote: Anybody, somebody or nobody is ever going to make your life any more than you are willing to do for yourself. So, stop looking around for anybody to do something for you; instead, get your own body going and get it done now.
107.Author: ~ Byron Pulsifer

108.Quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
108.Author: ~ Ray Kroc
